intro: Reseda alopecuros, commonly known as narrowleaf catchfly, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pinkish or white flowers. The plant typically grows in grassy areas, meadows, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Reseda alopecuros is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support pollinator populations.
